articles.title: US FDA advisers back Moderna COVID-19 booster shots for older and high-risk people - CNA
articles.description: WASHINGTON: A panel of expert advisers to the US Food and Drug Administration unanimously voted on Thursday (Oct 14) to recommend booster shots of Moderna's COVID-19 vaccine for Americans aged 65 and older and those at high risk of severe illness or occupatio…

articles.author: Sporting News
articles.title: "Dzsudzsák Balázs tudna segíteni a magyar válogatottnak" - Goal.com
articles.description: Lionel Messi's Argentina and Neymar's Brazil are leading South American qualifying for the 2022 FIFA World Cup. The top four qualify directly and the fifth-place team will advance to a playoff.

articles.title: Coca-Cola's bottler is heading to the JSE - in what could be a R120 billion listing - News24
articles.description: The soft drinks giant is poised to appoint Bank of America, Morgan Stanley and Standard Bank to run the initial public offering

articles.title: Covid vaccine rollout: 10 months later, no significant side effects in 6 million US people | Health24 - News24
articles.description: Medical records of millions of Americans who received the Pfizer or Moderna vaccine indicate no serious health effects linked to the jabs, according to the CDC.
articles.content: The first Covid-19 vaccination in the US took place on 14 December 2020. Now, almost a year later, results from an ongoing monitoring system provide reassurance to the public that the vaccines are sa… [+520 chars]

articles.title: Popular theory of Native American origins debunked by genetics and skeletal biology: Latest scientific findings suggest the ancestral Native American population does not originate in Japan, as believed by many archeologists - Science Daily
articles.description: A widely accepted theory of Native American origins coming from Japan has been attacked in a new scientific study, which shows that the genetics and skeletal biology 'simply does not match-up.'
